description: Bitbucket is a Git-based code hosting and collaboration platform supporting private and public repositories, enabling teams to manage and review code through pull requests and integrations

tools.name: BITBUCKET_CREATE_BRANCH
tools.description: Creates a new branch in a Bitbucket repository from a target commit hash; the branch name must be unique, adhere to Bitbucket's naming conventions, and not include the 'refs/heads/' prefix.

inputSchema.title: CreateBranchRequest

name.title: Name
name.description: The name for the new branch (e.g., 'feature/new-login', 'bugfix/issue-123'). Important: Do not include the 'refs/heads/' prefix.

repo_slug.title: Repo Slug
repo_slug.description: The slug or UUID of the repository where the branch will be created. This is usually the repository's name in URL-friendly format.

workspace.title: Workspace
workspace.description: The workspace ID or UUID that owns the repository. This can typically be found in the URL of your Bitbucket workspace.

target_hash.title: Target Hash
target_hash.description: The full commit hash (SHA1) from which the new branch will be created. This commit must exist in the repository.

inputSchema.description: Request model for creating a new branch in a Bitbucket repository.

tools.name: BITBUCKET_CREATE_ISSUE
tools.description: Creates a new issue in a Bitbucket repository, setting the authenticated user as reporter; ensures assignee (if provided) has repository access, and that any specified milestone, version, or component IDs exist.

due_on.title: Due On
due_on.description: Due date for the issue in ISO 8601 format (e.g., 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ').

content.title: Content
examples: Users are unable to log in when using Firefox browser
content.description: Detailed description for the new issue.

assignee.title: Assignee
assignee.description: Bitbucket username of the assignee. The assignee must have repository access.

repo_slug.title: Repo Slug
repo_slug.description: The slug of the Bitbucket repository.

workspace.title: Workspace
workspace.description: The ID or slug of the Bitbucket workspace.

version_id.title: Version Id
version_id.description: Numeric ID of an existing version to associate with this issue.

component_id.title: Component Id
component_id.description: Numeric ID of an existing component to associate with this issue.

milestone_id.title: Milestone Id
milestone_id.description: Numeric ID of an existing milestone to associate with this issue.

tools.name: BITBUCKET_CREATE_ISSUE_COMMENT
tools.description: Adds a new comment with markdown support to an existing Bitbucket issue.

inputSchema.title: CreateIssueCommentRequest

content.title: Content
examples: This is a comment with **bold** text
content.description: The raw text content for the comment. This content supports markdown formatting, which Bitbucket will then render.

issue_id.title: Issue Id
issue_id.description: The unique identifier of the issue on which the comment will be posted.

repo_slug.title: Repo Slug
repo_slug.description: The slug (URL-friendly version) of the repository name.

workspace.title: Workspace
workspace.description: The ID or slug of the workspace or user that owns the repository.

inputSchema.description: Request model for creating a comment on a Bitbucket issue.

tools.name: BITBUCKET_CREATE_PULL_REQUEST
tools.description: Creates a new pull request in a specified Bitbucket repository, ensuring the source branch exists and is distinct from the (optional) destination branch.

title.title: Title
examples: Fix: Resolve issue with user authentication
title.description: Concise title summarizing the changes for the pull request.

repo_slug.title: Repo Slug
repo_slug.description: Slug (URL-friendly name) of the repository for the pull request.

uuid.title: Uuid
uuid.description: UUID of the Bitbucket user to be a reviewer.

reviewers.title: Reviewers
reviewers.description: List of Bitbucket user UUIDs to be added as reviewers.

workspace.title: Workspace
workspace.description: Workspace ID (UUID or slug) of the repository owner.

description.title: Description
examples: This PR adds a new login page with improved security features and a redesigned UI. It addresses ticket #123.
Fixes a critical bug in the payment processing module that caused incorrect transaction amounts.
description.description: Detailed Markdown description of the pull request, outlining changes and purpose.

source_branch.title: Source Branch
source_branch.description: Name of the source branch with changes to be merged.

destination_branch.title: Destination Branch
destination_branch.description: Name of the destination branch for merging; defaults to repository's main branch if unspecified.

close_source_branch.title: Close Source Branch
close_source_branch.description: If true, automatically closes the source branch upon pull request merge.

tools.name: BITBUCKET_CREATE_REPOSITORY
tools.description: Creates a new Bitbucket 'git' repository in a specified workspace, defaulting to the workspace's oldest project if `project_key` is not provided.

has_wiki.title: Has Wiki
has_wiki.description: Enable the wiki (`True`), or disable it (`False`).

repo_slug.title: Repo Slug
repo_slug.description: URL-friendly slug for the new repository.

workspace.title: Workspace
workspace.description: ID or slug of the Bitbucket workspace for the new repository.

has_issues.title: Has Issues
has_issues.description: Enable the issue tracker (`True`), or disable it (`False`).

is_private.title: Is Private
is_private.description: Repository visibility: `True` for private, `False` for public.

fork_policy.title: Fork Policy
fork_policy.description: Forking policy for the repository, determining who can create forks.

project_key.title: Project Key
project_key.description: Key of the Bitbucket project for the repository; if omitted, it's placed in the workspace's oldest project.

tools.name: BITBUCKET_CREATE_SNIPPET_COMMENT
tools.description: Posts a new top-level comment or a threaded reply to an existing comment on a specified Bitbucket snippet.

content.title: Content
examples: This is a comment on the snippet
content.description: Raw text content of the comment; Bitbucket will render any included markup (like Markdown).

parent_id.title: Parent Id
parent_id.description: ID of an existing comment to reply to, creating a threaded comment; if omitted, a top-level comment is created.

workspace.title: Workspace
workspace.description: Workspace ID or slug (e.g., 'my_workspace_slug' or a UUID) for the Bitbucket workspace containing the snippet.

encoded_id.title: Encoded Id
encoded_id.description: Unique, encoded ID of the Bitbucket snippet to comment on (typically part of the snippet's URL).

tools.name: BITBUCKET_DELETE_ISSUE
tools.description: Permanently deletes a specific issue, identified by its `issue_id`, from the repository specified by `repo_slug` within the given `workspace`.

inputSchema.title: DeleteIssueRequest

issue_id.title: Issue Id
issue_id.description: The unique identifier of the issue to be deleted from the specified repository.

repo_slug.title: Repo Slug
repo_slug.description: The slug of the repository. This is the repository's name, usually in lowercase and with hyphens instead of spaces.

workspace.title: Workspace
workspace.description: The workspace ID (slug) or UUID of the Bitbucket workspace that owns the repository. This can be the workspace name or its universally unique identifier.

inputSchema.description: Request model for deleting an issue.

tools.name: BITBUCKET_DELETE_REPOSITORY
tools.description: Permanently deletes a specified Bitbucket repository; this action is irreversible and does not affect forks.

inputSchema.title: DeleteRepositoryRequest

repo_slug.title: Repo Slug
repo_slug.description: The slug (URL-friendly name) of the repository to be deleted. This identifies the repository within the workspace.

workspace.title: Workspace
workspace.description: The ID or slug of the Bitbucket workspace that owns the repository. This can be a user's username or a team's slug.

inputSchema.description: Request model for deleting a repository.

tools.name: BITBUCKET_GET_CURRENT_USER
tools.description: Retrieves the profile information (UUID, display name, links, creation date) for the currently authenticated Bitbucket user.

inputSchema.title: GetCurrentUserRequest
inputSchema.description: Request model for the GetCurrentUser action. No parameters are required.

tools.name: BITBUCKET_GET_FILE_FROM_REPOSITORY
tools.description: Retrieves a specific file's content from a Bitbucket repository at a given commit (hash, branch, or tag), failing if the file path is invalid for that commit.

path.title: Path
path.description: Full path to the file within the repository (e.g., 'src/main.py').

commit.title: Commit
commit.description: Commit hash, branch name (fetches latest), or tag for the file version.

repo_slug.title: Repo Slug
repo_slug.description: Repository slug or UUID (typically URL-formatted name).

workspace.title: Workspace
workspace.description: Workspace ID or UUID (often username or team name) containing the repository.

tools.name: BITBUCKET_GET_PULL_REQUEST
tools.description: Get a single pull request by ID with complete details.

inputSchema.title: GetPullRequestRequest

pull_request_id.title: Pull Request Id
pull_request_id.description: The ID of the pull request to retrieve.

inputSchema.description: Request to get a single pull request by ID.

tools.name: BITBUCKET_GET_SNIPPET
tools.description: Retrieves a specific Bitbucket snippet by its encoded ID from an existing workspace, returning its metadata and file structure.

inputSchema.title: GetSnippetRequest

workspace.title: Workspace
workspace.description: The workspace ID (slug) or the workspace UUID surrounded by curly braces, identifying the Bitbucket workspace.

encoded_id.title: Encoded Id
encoded_id.description: The unique identifier (encoded ID) of the snippet to be retrieved.

accept_format.title: Accept Format
accept_format.description: The desired format for the response. Valid options are 'application/json', 'multipart/related', or 'multipart/form-data'. This may affect how snippet content or file data is presented.

inputSchema.description: Request model for getting a snippet.

tools.name: BITBUCKET_LIST_PULL_REQUESTS
tools.description: Lists pull requests in a specified, accessible Bitbucket repository, optionally filtering by state (OPEN, MERGED, DECLINED).

inputSchema.title: ListPullRequestsRequest

page.title: Page
page.description: Page number for paginated results (starts from 1).

state.title: PullRequestState
state.description: Lifecycle state of a pull request.

pagelen.title: Pagelen
pagelen.description: Number of pull requests per page (1-100). Bitbucket default if not specified.

inputSchema.description: Lists pull requests in a specified repository.

tools.name: BITBUCKET_LIST_REPOSITORIES_IN_WORKSPACE
tools.description: Lists repositories in a specified Bitbucket workspace, accessible to the authenticated user, with options to filter by role or query string, and sort results.

q.title: Q
q.description: Query string using Bitbucket's REST API filtering syntax to filter repositories. For detailed syntax, refer to Bitbucket API documentation.

role.title: Role
role.description: Filters repositories by the authenticated user's role within each repository.

sort.title: Sort
sort.description: Field for sorting repository results. Prefix with '-' for descending order. Common sortable fields: 'name', 'updated_on', 'created_on'.

workspace.title: Workspace
workspace.description: The identifier of the Bitbucket workspace. This can be the workspace slug (e.g., 'my-workspace') or its UUID enclosed in curly braces (e.g., '{workspace-uuid}').

tools.name: BITBUCKET_LIST_WORKSPACE_MEMBERS
tools.description: Lists all members of a specified Bitbucket workspace; the workspace must exist.

inputSchema.title: ListWorkspaceMembersRequest

workspace.title: Workspace
workspace.description: The workspace ID (UUID) or slug from which to list members. The slug is the user-friendly, URL-safe identifier for the workspace.

inputSchema.description: Request model for the BITBUCKET_LIST_WORKSPACE_MEMBERS action.

tools.name: BITBUCKET_LIST_WORKSPACES
tools.description: Lists Bitbucket workspaces accessible to the authenticated user, optionally filtered and sorted.

inputSchema.title: ListWorkspacesRequest

q.title: Q
q.description: Query string to filter workspaces by attributes, following Bitbucket's filtering syntax.

sort.title: Sort
sort.description: Field to sort returned workspaces by; prefix with a hyphen (-) for descending order.

inputSchema.description: Request model for the ListWorkspaces action. Specifies optional query parameters for filtering and sorting workspaces.

tools.name: BITBUCKET_UPDATE_ISSUE
tools.description: Updates an existing issue in a Bitbucket repository by modifying specified attributes; requires `workspace`, `repo_slug`, `issue_id`, and at least one attribute to update.

inputSchema.title: UpdateIssueRequest

kind.title: Kind
kind.description: The updated kind (type) for the issue. If omitted, kind remains unchanged.

state.title: State
state.description: The updated state for the issue. If omitted, state remains unchanged.

title.title: Title
examples: Updated critical bug fix for login
title.description: The new title for the issue. If omitted, the title remains unchanged.

content.title: Content
examples: Detailed description of the updated steps to reproduce and the fix applied.
content.description: The new content or description for the issue, in raw text format. If omitted, the content remains unchanged.

version.title: Version
version.description: The name of the version affected by this issue (e.g., '1.0.0', '2.0-beta'). If omitted, the version remains unchanged.

issue_id.title: Issue Id
issue_id.description: The unique identifier (ID) of the issue to be updated.

priority.title: Priority
priority.description: The updated priority for the issue. If omitted, priority remains unchanged.

component.title: Component
component.description: The name of the component to associate with the issue (e.g., 'API', 'Frontend'). If omitted, the component remains unchanged.

milestone.title: Milestone
milestone.description: The name of the milestone to associate with the issue (e.g., 'Sprint 1', 'v1.0 Launch'). If omitted, the milestone remains unchanged.

repo_slug.title: Repo Slug
repo_slug.description: The slug or name of the repository (e.g., 'my-app-repo').

workspace.title: Workspace
workspace.description: The workspace ID or slug that owns the repository (e.g., 'my-company' or '{123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000}').

assignee_account_id.title: Assignee Account Id
assignee_account_id.description: The Bitbucket account ID (UUID) of the user to assign the issue to. If omitted, the assignee remains unchanged.

inputSchema.description: Request model for updating an existing issue in a Bitbucket repository.
